intro: Leptorkis alata, commonly known as the winged spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its distinctive, wing-like structures on its stems, which give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Leptorkis alata is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap.
